subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
Replaced earlier {{ltc-l|首|head|id=1}} due to homophony with {{ltc-l|手|hand}} ({{zh-ref|Sagart, 1999}}).

Several etymologies have been proposed:
* From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*d-bu-s||head}} or its allofam {{m|sit-pro|*du||head}}; compare {{cog|bo|དབུ||head}}, {{cog|my|ဦး||head}}, {{cog|ii|ꀑ||head}}, {{cog|tbq-lol-pro|*ʔ-du²||head}} ({{zh-ref|Benedict, 1972}}; {{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}; STEDT; {{zh-ref|Starostin}}).
* From {{der|zh|mkh-pro|*dulʔ|*duul()|to carry on one's head}}, whence {{cog|km|ទូល}}; this is phonologically plausible since final consonants are often lost after a long vowel in loanwords ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).
* A variant of {{och-l|豆|a kind of vessel}}, as skulls could have been used as drinking recipients; compare {{cog|fr|tête||head}} from {{cog|la|testa||pot; jug}} and {{cog|de|Kopf||head}} from {{cog|gmh|kopf||drinking vessel}} ({{zh-ref|Maréchal, 1994}}; {{zh-ref|Sagart, 1999}}). However, {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} notes that {{och-l|豆}} seems like a tone C ({{zh-l|*去聲}}) derivation from {{och-l|頭}}, which may have originally meant “skull”.
* {{zh-ref|Baxter and Sagart (2014)}} reconstructs the Old Chinese with a ''*m-'' suffix for human body parts, deriving it from {{och-l|兜|helmet; hood}}.

subSections.title: Readings
subSections.text:
{{ja-readings
|goon=ず<づ
|kanon=とう
|toon=じゅう<ぢゆう
|kanyoon=と
|kun=あたま-, かしら-, かぶり-, こうべ-<かうべ-
|nanori=かぶ, かぶし, かみ, ちゃん, つぶり, つむ, つむり, づ, どたま
}}

subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{ja-kanjitab|あたま|yomi=k}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=あたま|-}} of {{unknown|ja|nocap=1|sort=あたま}} derivation. Theories include:
* Compound of {{m|ja|天}}{{m|ja|玉|tr=a tama|lit=[[heaven]], [[sky]] + [[ball]]}}.  This is problematic phonetically, as {{m|ja|天}} appears historically as ''ama'' or ''ame'', not as just ''a''
* Compound of {{m|ja|当てる|当て}}{{m|ja|間|tr=ate ma|lit=putting something in contact + [[space]], [[gap]]}}, referring to the head as a [[moxibustion]] point.  This is also problematic phonetically, as the shift from ''ate'' to ''ata'' necessitates a change in meaning of the underlying verb.  This is also problematic semantically, as the {{m|ja|間|tr=ma}} term refers more specifically to a {{m|en|gap}} or {{m|en|space}}.
* Compound of {{m|ja|貴}}{{m|ja|間|tr=ate ma|lit=[[noble]] + space}}, referring to the most important part of the body.  However, the use of {{m|ja|間|tr=ma}} in this way is again problematic.  Moreover, {{m|ja|貴|tr=ate||noble}} appears in ''{{w|The Tale of the Bamboo Cutter}}'' dating to the 900s CE, while {{lang|ja|頭}} (''atama'') with a sense of {{m|en|fontanelle}} appears in the ''{{w|Wamyō Ruijushō}}'' dated 938 CE, leaving insufficient time for either the semantic or phonetic drift required.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

Historically, this term first appears with a sense of {{m|en|fontanelle}}, in reference to the soft place on the top of an infant's head where the bones of the skull have not yet fused.  As such, a more likely derivation might be as a compound of {{compound|ja|当たる|alt1=当た|tr1=ata|t1=not quite touching, not quite in contact|pos1=possibly a fossilized {{m|ja|未然形|tr=mizenkei||incomplete form}} of classical verb {{m|ja|当つ|tr=atsu}}, root of modern {{m|ja|当たる|tr=ataru||to touch, to come into contact}}|間|tr2=ma|t2=space, gap, opening}}.

subSections.title: Noun
Idioms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かしら}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=かしら|-}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>  Found as a standalone noun in the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'', completed some time after 759 CE, and as a counter in the ''{{w|Kojiki}}'', dating to 712 CE.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|かしら|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}
* The pitch accent for the counter depends on the preceding noun.

subSections.title: Counter
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|counter|かしら}}

# a [[head]], as when counting [[people]], or [[cattle]] or other [[livestock]]

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|かしら}}

# the [[head]] as a whole
# [[boss]], [[leader]]
# top part of a [[Chinese character]]
# the [[head]] of a [[doll]]

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|かぶり|yomi=k}}

Cognate with and shift in meaning from {{ja-r|かぶり||covering; hat, crown}}, spelled in kanji as {{m|ja|被り}} or {{m|ja|冠}}.

subSections.title: Idioms
Etymology 4
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|かぶ|yomi=irr}}

Cognate with {{ja-r|株|かぶ|stump; root}}, from a general sense of {{m|en|lump}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 5
Etymology 6
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|つむり|yomi=irr}}

From ''tsuburi'' above. Bilabial plosive {{IPAchar|/b/}} becomes bilabial nasal {{IPAchar|/m/}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 7
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|つむ|yomi=irr}}

Shortened from ''tsumuri'' above.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 8
Derived terms
Etymology 9
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|どたま|yomi=irr}}

Contraction of {{prefix|ja|sort=とたま'|ど|tr1=do|t1=super-|pos1=often used ironically as a derogatory prefix|頭|tr2=atama|t2=head}}.

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: Often spelled in hiragana, as {{m|ja|どたま}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 10
Usage notes
subSections.text: This reading is more often found in compounds, such as {{m|ja|頭痛|tr=zutsū||a headache}}.

subSections.title: Idioms
Etymology 11
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|とう|yomi=o}}

From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=す'|-}} {{ltc-l|頭}}. The ''{{ll|ja|漢音|kan'on}}'' reading, so likely a later borrowing. The shift from initial {{IPAchar|/d/}} to voiceless {{IPAchar|/t/}} is due to influence or reborrowing from a later stage of the Chinese language.  Compare modern {{cog|cmn|-}} reading ''tóu'', {{cog|yue|-}} ''tau<sup>4</sup>'', {{cog|nan|-}} ''tao<sup>5</sup>''.

[[Category:Japanese basic words|あたま]]

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: Cognate with mainland {{cog|ja|頭|tr=tsuburi}}, dialectal {{m|ja|頭|tr=tsuburo}}, itself probably a compound of {{m|ja|粒|tr=tsubu||round thing, such as a grain}} + {{m|ja|ろ|tr=ro||pos=suffix indicating a state or condition}}.
